info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 22 at 12:34AM CDT until further notice by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN HEMPSTEAD...NORTHEASTERN LAFAYETTE...NEVADA AND NORTHWESTERN COLUMBIA COUNTIES... At 1233 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Okolona to near Buckner, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Prescott, Waldo, Emmet, Buckner, Rosston, Willisville, Bodcaw, Bluff City, White Oak Lake State Park, Cale, Young, Sutton, Waterloo, Falcon, Boughton, Mount Moriah, College Hill, Lamartine, Morris and Laneburg. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for southwestern Arkansas. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
